definition: to keep hidden/to keep in one's private possession/secret store/stash
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: Police arrested the man for illegal possession of a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 随后，警方以非法私藏凶器为由逮捕了该男子。

sentences.english: And this was a positional wanner possession of marijuana case. We sought , and we thought a motion to express suppress evidence.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个私藏大麻的案件，我们提议不举证来应对。

sentences.english: Does your company have a policy regarding concealed weapons?
sentences.chinese: 你们公司有没有关于私藏枪支方面的政策？

sentences.english: Last year he accumulated many scarce items.
sentences.chinese: 去年他私藏了许多珍贵的物品。

sentences.english: It's government property and illegal to keep it or try to sell it.
sentences.chinese: 那是政府财产，任何私藏或倒卖行为均属违法。

sentences.english: Originally, dad early psych out my mind, oneself conceals a box.
sentences.chinese: 原来，爸爸早猜透了我的心思，自己私藏了一盒。

sentences.english: The Hisense air-conditioning has infinity transmitter near its draft flue.
sentences.chinese: 我家的海信空调通风管附近私藏有窃听器。

sentences.english: Smoke and mirrors have long been the preserve of magicians.
sentences.chinese: 烟雾和镜面从来都是魔术师的必备私藏。

sentences.english: They were found guilty of possessing petrol bombs.
sentences.chinese: 他们被发现私藏汽油弹而获罪。

definition: to take for one's own/to expropriate
to appropriate to oneself (what rightfully belongs to others)
to sell illicitly/to bootleg/to sell privately
to gather (people)/to collect (talent)/to come to an end
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to steal sth and sell it
to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
